info.title: Shortly API
info.description: API documentation for the Link Management System

post.summary: Sends an email verification link to the specified or current user's email address.
post.description: Access: This endpoint can be used by both authenticated and unauthenticated users. If the user is authenticated and no email is provided in the request, the current user's email will be used. A new verification token is generated, and any existing tokens are invalidated for security. Sample request: POST /api/auth/send-email-verification { "email": "user@example.com" } Sample response: { "emailSent": true, "message": "Verification email sent successfully." }

requestBody.description: The request containing the email address (optional if user is authenticated).

200.description: Verification email was queued successfully.

400.description: The request data is invalid or malformed.

403.description: User does not have permission to send verification email.

404.description: No user was found with the specified email address.

409.description: The email address is already verified.

post.summary: Verifies a user's email address using the provided verification token and returns authentication details.

requestBody.description: The request containing the encrypted verification token from the email link.

200.description: Email was verified successfully and authentication tokens are provided.

400.description: The request data is invalid or malformed.

404.description: Verification token is not found or invalid.

409.description: Token has already been used.

post.summary: Initiates an email change process by validating the current password and sending a confirmation email to the new address.
post.description: Authentication Required: User must be authenticated to change their email address. This endpoint begins a two-step email change process for security: Validates the user's current password Checks that the new email isn't already in use Sends a confirmation link to the NEW email address The email change is not completed until the user clicks the confirmation link sent to the new email address. Sample request: POST /api/auth/change-email { "newEmail": "newemail@example.com", "password": "current_user_password" } Sample response: { "success": true, "message": "Email change confirmation sent to your new email address." }

requestBody.description: The request containing the new email address and current password for verification.

200.description: Email change process was initiated successfully.

400.description: The request data is invalid or malformed.

403.description: User does not have permission to change email.

404.description: Current user not found.

409.description: The new email address is already in use by another user.

post.summary: Completes the email change process by validating the confirmation token and updating the user's email address.

requestBody.description: The request containing the encrypted confirmation token from the email change confirmation link.

200.description: The email address was updated successfully.

400.description: The request data is invalid or malformed.

404.description: Confirmation token isn't found or invalid.

409.description: The new email address is already in use (double-check protection).

post.summary: Initiates the password reset process by sending a password reset link to the user's email address.
post.description: Security: This endpoint implements anti-enumeration protection by always returning success, regardless of whether the email address exists in the system. If the email address exists and the user is active: A password reset token is generated A reset email is queued for sending The token has a shorter expiration time for enhanced security If the email doesn't exist or the user is inactive/deleted, no email is sent, but the response is identical to prevent attackers from discovering valid email addresses. Sample request: POST /api/auth/forgot-password { "email": "user@example.com" } Sample response: { "success": true, "message": "If the email address exists, a password reset link has been sent." }

requestBody.description: The request containing the email address for password reset.

200.description: Password reset process was initiated (always returned to prevent user enumeration).

post.summary: Validates a password reset token without consuming it to check if it's valid for password reset.
post.description:
This endpoint is typically used by frontend applications to validate reset tokens before 
presenting the password reset form to users. It performs comprehensive validation including
existence, expiration, and usage checks without consuming the token.

This allows users to refresh the page or navigate away from the reset form without 
invalidating their reset link.

Sample request:

    POST /api/auth/validate-reset-token
    {
        "token": "encrypted_reset_token_from_email"
    }

Sample response:

    {
        "isValid": true,
        "message": "Token is valid."
    }

requestBody.description: The request containing the encrypted password reset token to validate.

200.description: Returns whether the token is valid or not.

post.summary: Resets a user's password using a valid password reset token and revokes all existing user sessions.
post.description:
This endpoint performs a complete password reset process:
<list type="number"><item><description>Validates and consumes the reset token (marks it as used)</description></item><item><description>Updates the user's password with proper security hashing</description></item><item><description>Revokes all existing user sessions for security</description></item></list>

After a successful password reset, the user will need to log in again with their new password.
The reset token cannot be reused once consumed.

Sample request:

    POST /api/auth/reset-password
    {
        "token": "encrypted_reset_token_from_email",
        "newPassword": "new_secure_password_123!"
    }

Sample response:

    {
        "success": true,
        "message": "Password reset successfully. Please log in with your new password."
    }

requestBody.description: The request containing the encrypted reset token and new password.

200.description: Password was reset successfully.

400.description: The request data is invalid or malformed.

404.description: Reset token is not found or invalid.

409.description: Token has already been used.

503.description: The password update service is temporarily unavailable.

post.summary: Changes an authenticated user's password after validating their current password and revokes all existing sessions.
post.description: Authentication Required: User must be authenticated to change their password. This endpoint is used for authenticated password changes (as opposed to password resets via email). It requires the user to provide their current password for security verification. Security measures implemented: Current password validation before allowing change All user sessions are revoked after a successful password change User must re-authenticate with the new password This prevents session hijacking if the password change was initiated due to a security concern. Sample request: POST /api/auth/change-password { "currentPassword": "old_password_123", "newPassword": "new_secure_password_456!", "confirmPassword": "new_secure_password_456!" } Sample response: { "success": true, "message": "Password changed successfully. All sessions have been logged out." }

requestBody.description: The request containing the current password for verification and the new password.

200.description: The password was changed successfully.

400.description: The request data is invalid or malformed.

401.description: User is not authenticated or the current password is invalid.

404.description: Current user not found.

503.description: The password update service is temporarily unavailable.

get.summary: Searches for users and returns basic information with pagination support.

200.description: Returns the paginated search results

400.description: Invalid search parameters provided

403.description: User lacks permission to view all users

get.summary: Searches for users and returns complete information including profile, security, and usage data.
get.description:
This endpoint returns comprehensive user data and should be used when detailed information is required.
For better performance with large datasets, consider using the basic search endpoint instead.

200.description: Returns the complete paginated search results

400.description: Invalid search parameters provided

403.description: User lacks permission to view all users

put.summary: Forces an update on a specific user, bypassing normal validation rules.
put.description:
This is a privileged operation that bypasses standard validation rules. Use with caution as it can override system
constraints. All operations are logged for audit purposes.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the user to update

requestBody.description: The force update request containing the changes to apply

200.description: User successfully updated

400.description: Invalid user ID or update request

403.description: User lacks permission to update users

404.description: User with the specified ID was not found

delete.summary: Permanently deletes a user and all associated data from the system.
delete.description:
WARNING: This operation is irreversible and will permanently delete the user and all associated data. Consider
using soft delete instead unless permanent deletion is absolutely necessary.
When deleteOwnedShortUrls is false, short URLs will be reassigned or made anonymous. When true, they will be
permanently deleted.
Example usage: DELETE /api/admin/users/hard-delete/12345678-1234-1234-1234-123456789012?deleteOwnedShortUrls=true

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the user to delete

parameters.name: deleteOwnedShortUrls
parameters.description: Whether to delete short URLs owned by the user (default: false)

400.description: Invalid user ID provided

403.description: User lacks permission to hard delete users

404.description: User with the specified ID was not found

put.summary: Activates multiple users in a single batch operation.
put.description:
This operation will attempt to activate all provided users. The response will include details about successful and
failed operations. Partial success is possible - some users may be activated while others fail.

requestBody.description: Collection of user IDs to activate

200.description: Bulk operation completed with results

400.description: Invalid user IDs or empty collection provided

403.description: User lacks permission to activate users

put.summary: Deactivates multiple users in a single batch operation.
put.description:
This operation will attempt to deactivate all provided users. Deactivated users will lose access to the system, but
their data will be preserved. The response includes details about successful and failed operations.

requestBody.description: Collection of user IDs to deactivate

200.description: Bulk operation completed with results

400.description: Invalid user IDs or empty collection provided

403.description: User lacks permission to deactivate users

delete.summary: Soft deletes multiple users in a single batch operation.
delete.description:
This operation performs soft deletion, marking users as deleted while
preserving their data for potential recovery. The operation is audited
with the current administrator's ID for accountability.
Users will be immediately inaccessible, but data can be recovered if needed.

requestBody.description: Collection of user IDs to softly delete

200.description: Bulk operation completed with results

400.description: Invalid user IDs or empty collection provided

403.description: User lacks permission to delete users or unable to determine current admin ID

post.summary: Registers a new user account with email verification.
post.description:
Creates a new user account and automatically sends an email verification link.
The user receives authentication tokens immediately, but email confirmation may be required
for certain features depending on the system configuration.

Sample request:

    POST /api/auth/register
    {
        "email": "user@example.com",
        "username": "newuser123",
        "password": "SecurePassword123!"
    }

requestBody.description: The registration request containing user details.

200.description: User was registered successfully and authentication tokens are provided.

400.description: The request data is invalid or malformed.

post.summary: Authenticates a user with email/username and password credentials.
post.description:
Validates user credentials and provides JWT access and refresh tokens for authenticated sessions.

Sample request:

    POST /api/auth/login
    {
        "emailOrUsername": "user@example.com",
        "password": "UserPassword123!"
    }

requestBody.description: The login request containing credentials.

200.description: User was authenticated successfully and tokens are provided.

400.description: The credentials are invalid or the request is malformed.

post.summary: Refreshes an expired access token using a valid refresh token.
post.description:
Generates new authentication tokens when the access token has expired, but the refresh token is still valid.
The old refresh token is invalidated, and a new one is issued for security.

Sample request:

    POST /api/auth/refresh-token
    {
        "refreshToken": "base64_encoded_refresh_token"
    }

requestBody.description: The request containing the refresh token.

200.description: New tokens were generated successfully.

400.description: The request is invalid or missing required data.

401.description: The refresh token is invalid or expired.

post.summary: Logs out the current user session by revoking the specified refresh token.
post.description: Authentication Required: User must be authenticated to logout. This endpoint revokes a specific refresh token, effectively logging out the user from the current session/device. The access token will continue to work until it expires naturally (typically within minutes), but the refresh token becomes unusable immediately. For complete immediate logout, the client should: Call this endpoint to revoke the refresh token Remove both access and refresh tokens from client storage Redirect user to login page Sample request: POST /api/auth/logout { "refreshToken": "base64_encoded_refresh_token" } Sample response: { "success": true, "message": "Logged out successfully." }

requestBody.description: The logout request containing the refresh token to revoke.

200.description: User was logged out successfully.

400.description: The request is invalid or missing required data.

404.description: The specified refresh token was not found.

post.summary: Logs out the user from all sessions by revoking all refresh tokens associated with their account.
post.description: Authentication Required: User must be authenticated to logout from all sessions. This endpoint provides a security feature to revoke ALL refresh tokens associated with the current user, effectively logging them out from all devices and sessions simultaneously. This is useful in scenarios such as: User suspects their account has been compromised User wants to log out from all devices after a password change User wants to revoke access from lost/stolen devices Security maintenance operations After calling this endpoint: All refresh tokens for the user are immediately revoked Existing access tokens continue to work until natural expiration User will need to re-authenticate on all devices/sessions Sample request: POST /api/auth/logout-all Sample response: { "success": true, "message": "Successfully logged out from all sessions." }

200.description: User was logged out from all sessions successfully.

404.description: User was not found or no active sessions to revoke.

post.summary: Tracks a click event for a specific short URL and returns the recorded click data.
post.description:
**Access:** [AllowAnonymous] This endpoint is accessible to everyone to enable click tracking for all users.
            
Sample Request:
            
    POST /api/urls/tracking/123456789/click
            
This endpoint automatically captures and records comprehensive click analytics including:
- **Geographic Information**: Country and city based on IP address
- **Device Information**: Browser, operating system, device type
- **Traffic Source**: Referrer domain and traffic source analysis
- **UTM Parameters**: Campaign tracking parameters from query string
- **Session Tracking**: Anonymous session identification
- **Timestamp**: Precise click timing in UTC

**Automatic Data Collection:**
The endpoint automatically extracts tracking data from the HTTP request:
- IP address (with proxy support via X-Forwarded-For)
- User agent string for device/browser detection
- Referrer header for traffic source analysis
- UTM parameters (utm_source, utm_medium, utm_campaign, utm_term, utm_content)
- Session identification for anonymous user tracking

**Privacy Considerations:**
- IP addresses are processed for geographic insights only
- No personally identifiable information is stored
- Complies with privacy regulations and best practices

parameters.name: shortUrlId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the short URL that was clicked.

403.description: Forbidden

200.description: Click event was tracked successfully. Returns the complete click event data.

400.description: The request is invalid (e.g., invalid shortUrlId).

404.description: Short URL with the specified ID was not found.

500.description: An internal server error occurred during click tracking.

get.summary: Retrieves comprehensive analytics for a specific short URL with optional date range filtering.
get.description:
Sample Requests:
            
    GET /api/urls/tracking/123456789/analytics
    GET /api/urls/tracking/123456789/analytics?startDate=2024-01-01T00:00:00Z
    GET /api/urls/tracking/123456789/analytics?startDate=2024-01-01T00:00:00Z&endDate=2024-12-31T23:59:59Z

This endpoint provides comprehensive analytics insights including:

**Core Metrics:**
- Total click count for the specified period
- Daily click trends (when date range is specified)

**Geographic Analytics:**
- Clicks breakdown by country
- Geographic distribution insights

**Device Analytics:**
- Clicks by device type (desktop, mobile, tablet)
- Browser and operating system statistics

**Traffic Source Analytics:**
- Traffic source breakdown (direct, social, search, referral)
- Referrer domain analysis
- UTM campaign performance

**Time-Based Analytics:**
- Daily click patterns (when date range is provided)
- Trend analysis over time

Perfect for creating dashboards, generating reports, and understanding user engagement patterns.

parameters.name: shortUrlId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the short URL to get analytics for.

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: Optional. The start date for analytics filtering (inclusive). If not provided, includes all historical data.

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: Optional. The end date for analytics filtering (inclusive). If not provided, includes data up to the current date.

403.description: User does not have permission to view analytics for this URL.

200.description: Returns comprehensive analytics data for the short URL.

400.description: The request parameters are invalid (e.g., invalid date format, start date after end date).

404.description: Short URL with the specified ID was not found.

get.summary: Retrieves real-time analytics for a specific short URL covering the last 24 hours.
get.description:
Sample Request:
            
    GET /api/urls/tracking/123456789/real-time

This endpoint provides live analytics insights for monitoring immediate URL performance.
It automatically analyzes data from the last 24 hours to show:

**Real-Time Insights:**
- Recent click activity and trends
- Geographic distribution of recent clicks
- Device and browser usage patterns
- Traffic source analysis for recent visitors
- Hourly click distribution

**Use Cases:**
- Live monitoring during campaigns
- Real-time performance dashboards
- Immediate feedback on marketing efforts
- Quick health checks for active URLs
- Social media campaign monitoring

**Performance Optimized:**
- Fixed 24-hour window for consistent response times
- Efficient queries for real-time data requirements
- Suitable for frequent polling and live updates

Perfect for real-time dashboards and monitoring active campaigns.

parameters.name: shortUrlId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the short URL to get real-time analytics for.

403.description: User does not have permission to view real-time analytics for this URL.

200.description: Returns real-time analytics data for the last 24 hours.

404.description: Short URL with the specified ID was not found.

get.summary: Retrieves the most recent click events for a specific short URL.
get.description:
Sample Requests:
            
    GET /api/urls/tracking/123456789/recent-clicks
    GET /api/urls/tracking/123456789/recent-clicks?count=20
    GET /api/urls/tracking/123456789/recent-clicks?count=50

This endpoint provides immediate visibility into recent user activity and engagement.
Each click event contains detailed information including:

**Click Event Details:**
- Timestamp of the click (UTC)
- Geographic location (country, city)
- Device information (browser, OS, device type)
- Traffic source and referrer information
- UTM campaign parameters
- Session and user agent details

**Use Cases:**
- Monitoring recent activity and engagement
- Debugging and troubleshooting click issues
- Understanding user behavior patterns
- Real-time activity feeds and notifications
- Quality assurance for tracking implementation

**Performance Considerations:**
- Results are ordered by most recent clicks first
- Limited to 100 items maximum for performance
- Efficient queries for quick response times
- Suitable for frequent polling and live updates

Perfect for activity monitoring and real-time user engagement insights.

parameters.name: shortUrlId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the short URL to get recent clicks for.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: The number of recent clicks to retrieve. Default is 10, maximum is 100.

403.description: User does not have permission to view click details for this URL.

200.description: Returns the list of recent click events.

400.description: The count parameter is invalid (e.g., negative value or exceeds maximum limit).

404.description: Short URL with the specified ID was not found.

get.summary: Retrieves paginated click history for a specific short URL.
get.description:
Sample Requests:
            
    GET /api/urls/tracking/123456789/click-history
    GET /api/urls/tracking/123456789/click-history?pageNumber=2
    GET /api/urls/tracking/123456789/click-history?pageNumber=1&pageSize=25
    GET /api/urls/tracking/123456789/click-history?pageNumber=3&pageSize=100

This endpoint provides comprehensive access to all historical click data with efficient pagination.
The response includes both the click events and pagination metadata:

**Response Structure:**
```json
{
  "items": [...], // Array of ClickEvent objects
  "totalCount": 1250, // Total number of clicks
  "pageNumber": 1, // Current page number
  "pageSize": 50, // Items per page
  "totalPages": 25, // Total number of pages
  "hasNextPage": true, // Whether next page exists
  "hasPreviousPage": false // Whether previous page exists
}
```

**Use Cases:**
- Historical data analysis and reporting
- Detailed audit trails and compliance
- Data export and backup operations
- Comprehensive analytics and insights
- User activity investigation and debugging

**Performance Optimized:**
- Efficient pagination to handle large datasets
- Ordered by click timestamp (most recent first)
- Optimized queries for fast response times
- Memory-efficient processing for large result sets

Perfect for comprehensive data analysis and historical reporting.

parameters.name: shortUrlId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the short URL to get click history for.

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: The page number to retrieve (starting from 1). Default is 1.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of items per page. Default is 50, maximum is 100.

403.description: User does not have permission to view click history for this URL.

200.description: Returns the paginated click history with metadata.

400.description: The pagination parameters are invalid (e.g., invalid page numbers or page size).

404.description: Short URL with the specified ID was not found.

delete.summary: Performs cleanup of old click tracking data based on a retention period.
delete.description:
Sample Requests:
            
        DELETE /api/urls/tracking/cleanup?retentionDays=365
        DELETE /api/urls/tracking/cleanup?retentionDays=180
        DELETE /api/urls/tracking/cleanup?retentionDays=90
            
            


** WARNING: This operation permanently deletes old click data and cannot be undone.**

This endpoint performs system-wide cleanup of historical click tracking data to:
- **Comply with Data Retention Policies**: Meet regulatory requirements for data retention
- **Optimize Database Performance**: Remove old data to improve query performance
- **Manage Storage Costs**: Reduce database storage requirements
- **Maintain System Health**: Prevent database bloat from excessive historical data

**Administrative Operation:**
This is a system-level maintenance operation that affects click data across all URLs and users.
Only users with appropriate administrative permissions should have access to this endpoint.

**Best Practices:**
- Run during low-traffic periods to minimize system impact
- Consider backing up data before cleanup if needed for compliance
- Monitor the number of deleted records to ensure expected behavior
- Schedule regular cleanup operations based on your retention policies

**Common Retention Periods:**
- **GDPR Compliance**: Typically 12-24 months
- **Analytics Needs**: 6-18 months for trend analysis
- **Storage Optimization**: 3-12 months depending on volume
- **Audit Requirements**: Varies by industry and regulations

parameters.name: retentionDays
parameters.description: The number of days to retain click data. Data older than this will be permanently deleted. Must be a positive value.

403.description: User does not have permission to perform system cleanup operations.

200.description: Cleanup completed successfully. Returns the number of deleted click events.

400.description: The retentionDays parameter is invalid (e.g., negative or zero value).

500.description: An internal server error occurred during cleanup processing.

get.summary: Retrieves the current security status of the specified user account.
get.description:
This endpoint is used by administrators or internal systems to assess the current security state of a user account.
It provides information such as whether the account is locked, the number of failed login attempts,
the reason for lockout, and how long it remains until the account is automatically unlocked (if applicable).

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the user to retrieve security information for.

403.description: Forbidden

200.description: The user's security status was retrieved successfully.

400.description: The request is invalid due to incorrect user ID format or parameters.

404.description: No user or security record was found for the specified ID.

500.description: An internal server error occurred while processing the request.

put.summary: Records a failed login attempt for the specified user.
put.description:
This endpoint is typically called by the authentication system when a user provides incorrect credentials.
The system will track the number of failed attempts and may trigger account locking
if a configured threshold is exceeded.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the user who had a failed login attempt.

403.description: Caller lacks permission to record security events.

200.description: The failed login attempt was successfully recorded.

400.description: Invalid user ID format or request parameters.

404.description: User or user security records were not found.

put.summary: Resets the failed login attempt counter for the specified user.
put.description:
This endpoint is typically called after a successful login or by an administrator to clear
a users failed login history.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the user whose failed attempt counter should be reset.

403.description: Caller lacks permission to manage user security.

200.description: The failed login attempt counter was successfully reset.

400.description: Invalid user ID format.

404.description: User or user security records were not found.

get.summary: Checks whether the specified user account is currently locked.

This endpoint allows checking if a user account is currently locked due to security policies,
failed login attempts, or administrative actions.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the user.

403.description: Caller lacks permission to view user security status.

200.description: Successfully retrieved the user's lock status.

400.description: Invalid user ID format.

404.description: User not found.

put.summary: Locks the specified user account until the given expiration date.
put.description: This endpoint allows administrators to manually lock user accounts for security purposes, such as suspected compromise, policy violations, or ongoing investigations. Important: When a user account is locked, all authentication tokens are revoked, and the user will be logged out from all devices.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the user to lock.

requestBody.description: The lock request containing the duration and optional reason.

403.description: Caller lacks permission to lock user accounts.

200.description: User account was successfully locked.

400.description: Invalid request parameters or user ID format.

404.description: User not found.

409.description: User account is already locked.

put.summary: Unlocks the specified user account, removing any lock restrictions.
put.description:
This endpoint allows administrators to manually unlock user accounts that were previously locked
due to security policies, failed login attempts, or administrative actions. Unlocking allows the
user to authenticate normally, but they must get new tokens.

200.description: User account was successfully unlocked.

400.description: Invalid user ID format.

404.description: User not found.

409.description: User account is not currently locked.

get.summary: Retrieves the total count of short URLs in the system.
get.description:
Sample Requests:
            
    GET /api/short-urls/analytics/total-count
    GET /api/short-urls/analytics/total-count?activeOnly=true
    GET /api/short-urls/analytics/total-count?activeOnly=false
            
This endpoint provides system-wide statistics for monitoring and dashboard purposes.
When activeOnly is true, it excludes deactivated, expired, and deleted URLs from the count.
Useful for generating reports and understanding system usage patterns.

parameters.name: activeOnly
parameters.description: Optional. If true, returns only active URLs. If false or not provided, returns all URLs including inactive ones. Default is false.

403.description: User does not have permission to view system analytics.

200.description: Returns the total count of short URLs.

get.summary: Retrieves the total number of clicks for a specific short URL.
get.description:
Sample Request:
            
    GET /api/short-urls/analytics/123456789/total-clicks

This endpoint provides click analytics for individual short URLs.
The click count includes all successful redirections and excludes failed attempts or blocked access.
Useful for monitoring individual URL performance and engagement metrics.

parameters.name: shortUrlId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the short URL to get click statistics for.

403.description: User does not have permission to view analytics for this URL.

200.description: Returns the total click count for the short URL.

404.description: Short URL with the specified ID was not found.

get.summary: Retrieves the most popular short URLs based on click count, optionally filtered by timeframe and user.
get.description:
Sample Requests:
            
    GET /api/short-urls/analytics/most-popular
    GET /api/short-urls/analytics/most-popular?topCount=5
    GET /api/short-urls/analytics/most-popular?topCount=20&timeframeDays=30
    GET /api/short-urls/analytics/most-popular?userId=12345678-1234-1234-1234-123456789012
    GET /api/short-urls/analytics/most-popular?topCount=5&timeframeDays=7&userId=12345678-1234-1234-1234-123456789012

This endpoint provides insights into the most engaging content by analyzing click patterns.
Results are ordered by total clicks in descending order (most popular first).
The timeframeDays parameter allows for trend analysis over specific periods.
Useful for content performance analysis, trending content identification, and user engagement metrics.

parameters.name: topCount
parameters.description: The number of top URLs to retrieve. Default is 10, maximum is 100.

parameters.name: timeframeDays
parameters.description: Optional. Filter results to URLs clicked within the last specified number of days. If not provided, considers all-time data.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: Optional. Filter results to URLs created by the specified user. If not provided, includes URLs from all users.

403.description: User does not have permission to view popularity analytics.

200.description: Returns the list of most popular short URLs.

400.description: The request parameters are invalid (e.g., invalid topCount range, negative timeframeDays, invalid userId format).

get.summary: Retrieves a comprehensive analytics summary for a specific user.
get.description:
Sample Request:
            
    GET /api/short-urls/analytics/user/12345678-1234-1234-1234-123456789012/summary

This endpoint provides a comprehensive overview of user activity and engagement metrics.
The summary typically includes metrics such as:
- Total number of URLs created by the user
- Total clicks across all user's URLs
- Average clicks per URL
- Most popular URLs
- Recent activity trends

Useful for user dashboards, performance reports, and individual user analytics.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the user to get analytics for.

403.description: User does not have permission to view analytics for the specified user.

200.description: Returns the user analytics summary.

400.description: The userId parameter is invalid (e.g., invalid GUID format).

404.description: User with the specified ID was not found.

get.summary: Retrieves comprehensive analytics summary for a specific organization.
get.description:
Sample Request:
            
    GET /api/short-urls/analytics/organization/87654321-4321-4321-4321-210987654321/summary

This endpoint provides a comprehensive overview of organization-wide activity and engagement metrics.
The summary typically includes metrics such as:
- Total number of URLs created by organization members
- Total clicks across all organization URLs
- Top performing members and their contribution
- Most popular organization URLs
- Usage trends and patterns
- Team performance metrics

Useful for organization dashboards, team performance analysis, and administrative reporting.
Only users with appropriate organization-level permissions can access this data.

parameters.name: organizationId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the organization to get analytics for.

403.description: User does not have permission to view analytics for the specified organization.

200.description: Returns the organization analytics summary.

400.description: The organizationId parameter is invalid (e.g., invalid GUID format).

404.description: Organization with the specified ID was not found.

get.summary: Retrieves short URLs that are approaching their click limits with pagination support.
get.description:
Sample Requests:
            
    GET /api/short-urls/analytics/approaching-limit
    GET /api/short-urls/analytics/approaching-limit?warningThreshold=0.9
    GET /api/short-urls/analytics/approaching-limit?warningThreshold=0.85&pageNumber=1&pageSize=25

This endpoint identifies URLs that are close to reaching their configured click limits.
For example, if a URL has a click limit of 100 and warningThreshold is 0.8, it will be included
when it reaches 80 or more clicks.

Useful for:
- Proactive monitoring and alerting
- Preventing service disruptions due to exceeded limits  
- Capacity planning and limit management
- Automated notifications to URL owners

Only URLs with defined click limits are considered in this analysis.

parameters.name: warningThreshold
parameters.description: The threshold percentage (as decimal) at which URLs should be considered approaching their limit. Default is 0.8 (80%). Must be between 0.1 and 1.0.

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: The page number to retrieve (starting from 1). Default is 1.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of items per page. Default is 50, maximum is 100.

403.description: User does not have permission to view limit analytics.

200.description: Returns the paginated list of URLs approaching their click limits.

400.description: The request parameters are invalid (e.g., warningThreshold out of range, invalid pagination parameters).

post.summary: Creates multiple short URLs in a single batch operation.
post.description: Access: The service will handle permissions and feature availability based on the user's authentication status and role. Sample request: POST /api/short-urls/bulk/create { "requests": [ { "originalUrl": "https://www.example1.com", "customShortCode": "example1", "clickLimit": 100, "trackingEnabled": true, "title": "Example 1" }, { "originalUrl": "https://www.example2.com", "customShortCode": "example2", "clickLimit": 100, "trackingEnabled": true, "title": "Example 2" } } Performance Benefits: - Reduced network overhead compared to individual requests - Optimized database operations with batch processing - Transactional consistency across multiple URL creations Conflict Handling: - URLs with conflicting custom codes are skipped and reported - Successful URLs are still created even if some fail - Detailed conflict messages help identify and resolve issues

requestBody.description: A collection of short URL creation requests to process in bulk.

403.description: User does not have permission to create URLs in bulk.

200.description: Bulk creation completed. Check response for detailed results including any conflicts.

400.description: The request data is invalid or malformed (e.g., empty request collection, invalid URL formats).

500.description: An internal server error occurred during bulk processing.

put.summary: Updates the expiration date for multiple short URLs in a single batch operation.
put.description:
Sample request:

    PUT /api/short-urls/bulk/update-expiration
    {
        "ids": [123456789, 987654321, 456789123],
        "newExpirationDate": "2024-12-31T23:59:59Z"
    }

This endpoint allows efficient management of URL expiration dates across multiple URLs.
Setting newExpirationDate to null removes the expiration (makes URLs permanent).

**Use Cases:**
- Extending expiration for campaign URLs
- Batch management of temporary URLs
- Emergency expiration updates
- Removing expiration from URLs that should be permanent

Only URLs that the authenticated user has permission to modify will be updated.

requestBody.description: The bulk update request containing URL IDs and the new expiration date.

403.description: User does not have permission to update URLs in bulk.

200.description: Bulk expiration update completed. Check response for detailed results.

400.description: The request data is invalid (e.g., empty ID collection, invalid date format).

500.description: An internal server error occurred during bulk processing.

delete.summary: Deletes multiple short URLs in a single batch operation.
delete.description:
Sample request:

    DELETE /api/short-urls/bulk/delete
    {
        "ids": [123456789, 987654321, 456789123]
    }

** WARNING: This operation permanently deletes URLs and cannot be undone.**

This endpoint efficiently removes multiple URLs in a single operation.
All associated analytics data and click history will also be deleted.

**Use Cases:**
- Cleanup of expired or obsolete URLs
- Bulk removal of test URLs
- Administrative maintenance operations
- User account cleanup

Only URLs that the authenticated user has permission to delete will be removed.

requestBody.description: The bulk delete request containing the IDs of URLs to delete.

403.description: User does not have permission to delete URLs in bulk.

200.description: Bulk deletion completed. Check response for detailed results.

400.description: The request data is invalid (e.g., empty ID collection).

500.description: An internal server error occurred during bulk processing.

delete.summary: Deletes all expired short URLs from the system.
delete.description:
Sample request:

    DELETE /api/short-urls/bulk/delete-expired

** WARNING: This operation permanently deletes all expired URLs and cannot be undone.**

This endpoint performs system-wide cleanup by removing URLs that have passed their expiration date.
It's typically used for:
- Automated maintenance jobs
- Database cleanup operations
- Storage optimization
- Compliance with data retention policies

**Administrative Operation:**
This is a system-level operation that affects URLs across all users and organizations.
Only users with appropriate administrative permissions should have access to this endpoint.

403.description: User does not have permission to perform system-wide cleanup operations.

200.description: Expired URLs cleanup completed. Check response for the number of deleted URLs.

500.description: An internal server error occurred during cleanup processing.

put.summary: Activates multiple short URLs in a single batch operation.
put.description:
Sample request:

    PUT /api/short-urls/bulk/activate
    {
        "ids": [123456789, 987654321, 456789123]
    }

This endpoint enables multiple URLs that were previously deactivated.
Activated URLs become accessible again and can be used for redirections.

**Use Cases:**
- Re-enabling URLs after maintenance
- Bulk activation of seasonal campaigns
- Recovery from accidental deactivation
- Scheduled activation of prepared URLs

Only URLs that the authenticated user has permission to modify will be activated.
URLs that are already active will be included in the success count without any changes.

requestBody.description: The bulk activation request containing the IDs of URLs to activate.

403.description: User does not have permission to activate URLs in bulk.

200.description: Bulk activation completed. Check response for detailed results.

400.description: The request data is invalid (e.g., empty ID collection).

500.description: An internal server error occurred during bulk processing.

put.summary: Deactivate multiple short URLs in a single batch operation.
put.description:
Sample request:

    PUT /api/short-urls/bulk/deactivate
    {
        "ids": [123456789, 987654321, 456789123]
    }

This endpoint enables multiple URLs that were previously deactivated.
Deactivate URLs become accessible again and can be used for redirections.

**Use Cases:**
- Re-enabling URLs after maintenance
- Bulk deactivation of seasonal campaigns

Only URLs that the authenticated user has permission to modify will be deactivated.
URLs that are already not active will be included in the success count without any changes.

requestBody.description: The bulk deactivated request containing the IDs of URLs to deactivate.

403.description: User does not have permission to deactivate URLs in bulk.

200.description: Bulk deactivation completed. Check response for detailed results.

400.description: The request data is invalid (e.g., empty ID collection).

500.description: An internal server error occurred during bulk processing.

get.summary: Retrieves short URLs created by a specific user with pagination support.
get.description:
Sample Request:
            
    GET /api/short-urls/query/user/12345678-1234-1234-1234-123456789012?pageNumber=1&pageSize=20

This endpoint returns all short URLs created by the specified user, including both public and private URLs
that the authenticated user has permission to view.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the user whose URLs to retrieve.

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: The page number to retrieve (starting from 1). Default is 1.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of items per page. Default is 50, maximum is 100.

403.description: User does not have permission to view URLs for the specified user.

200.description: Returns the paginated list of user's short URLs.

400.description: The request parameters are invalid (e.g., invalid userId format, invalid pagination parameters).

get.summary: Retrieves short URLs created by users within a specific organization with pagination support.
get.description:
Sample Request:
            
    GET /api/short-urls/query/organization/87654321-4321-4321-4321-210987654321?pageNumber=1&pageSize=25

This endpoint returns all short URLs created by members of the specified organization.
Only users with appropriate permissions can access organization-level data.

parameters.name: organizationId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the organization whose URLs to retrieve.

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: The page number to retrieve (starting from 1). Default is 1.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of items per page. Default is 50, maximum is 100.

403.description: User does not have permission to view URLs for the specified organization.

200.description: Returns the paginated list of organization's short URLs.

400.description: The request parameters are invalid (e.g., invalid organizationId format, invalid pagination parameters).

404.description: Organization with the specified ID was not found.

get.summary: Retrieves anonymous short URLs created within a specific date range with pagination support.
get.description:
Sample Request:
            
    GET /api/short-urls/query/anonymous?startDate=2024-01-01T00:00:00Z&endDate=2024-12-31T23:59:59Z&pageNumber=1&pageSize=30

This endpoint returns short URLs that were created by anonymous users (not logged in) within the specified date range.
Useful for analytics and monitoring anonymous usage patterns.

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: The start date for the date range filter (inclusive).

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: The end date for the date range filter (inclusive).

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: The page number to retrieve (starting from 1). Default is 1.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of items per page. Default is 50, maximum is 100.

403.description: User does not have permission to view anonymous URLs.

200.description: Returns the paginated list of anonymous short URLs within the date range.

400.description: The request parameters are invalid (e.g., invalid date format, start date after end date, invalid pagination parameters).

get.summary: Retrieves expired short URLs with pagination support.
get.description:
Sample Request:
            
    GET /api/short-urls/query/expired?pageNumber=1&pageSize=20

This endpoint returns all short URLs that have passed their expiration date and are no longer active.
Useful for cleanup operations and expired URL management.

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: The page number to retrieve (starting from 1). Default is 1.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of items per page. Default is 50, maximum is 100.

403.description: User does not have permission to view expired URLs.

200.description: Returns the paginated list of expired short URLs.

400.description: The request parameters are invalid (e.g., invalid pagination parameters).

get.summary: Retrieves private short URLs for a specific user with pagination support.
get.description:
Sample Request:
            
    GET /api/short-urls/query/private/12345678-1234-1234-1234-123456789012?pageNumber=1&pageSize=15

This endpoint returns only private short URLs created by the specified user.
Private URLs are not visible to other users and require special permissions to access.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the user whose private URLs to retrieve.

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: The page number to retrieve (starting from 1). Default is 1.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of items per page. Default is 50, the maximum is 100.

403.description: User does not have permission to view private URLs for the specified user.

200.description: Returns the paginated list of user's private short URLs.

400.description: The request parameters are invalid (e.g., invalid userId format, invalid pagination parameters).

get.summary: Retrieves short URLs created within a specific date range with pagination support.
get.description:
Sample Request:
            
    GET /api/short-urls/query/date-range?startDate=2024-01-01T00:00:00Z&endDate=2024-12-31T23:59:59Z&pageNumber=1&pageSize=40

This endpoint returns all short URLs (both anonymous and authenticated users) created within the specified date range.
Useful for analytics, reporting, and monitoring URL creation patterns over time.

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: The start date for the date range filter (inclusive).

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: The end date for the date range filter (inclusive).

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: The page number to retrieve (starting from 1). Default is 1.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of items per page. Default is 50, maximum is 100.

403.description: User does not have permission to view URLs within the date range.

200.description: Returns the paginated list of short URLs within the date range.

400.description: The request parameters are invalid (e.g., invalid date format, start date after end date, invalid pagination parameters).

get.summary: Retrieves duplicate short URLs grouped by original URL.
get.description:
Sample Requests:
            
    GET /api/short-urls/query/duplicates
    GET /api/short-urls/query/duplicates?userId=12345678-1234-1234-1234-123456789012
    GET /api/short-urls/query/duplicates?organizationId=87654321-4321-4321-4321-210987654321
    GET /api/short-urls/query/duplicates?userId=12345678-1234-1234-1234-123456789012&organizationId=87654321-4321-4321-4321-210987654321

This endpoint identifies and returns groups of short URLs that point to the same original URL.
Useful for cleanup operations, optimization, and identifying redundant short URLs.
If neither userId nor organizationId is provided, it searches for duplicates across the entire system (admin-level operation).

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: Optional. The unique identifier of the user to filter duplicates for. If not provided, searches across all users.

parameters.name: organizationId
parameters.description: Optional. The unique identifier of the organization to filter duplicates for. If not provided, search across all organizations.

403.description: User does not have permission to view duplicates for the specified scope.

200.description: Returns the list of duplicate URL groups.

400.description: The request parameters are invalid (e.g., invalid GUID formats).

get.summary: Retrieves unused short URLs (URLs that have never been clicked) with pagination support.
get.description:
Sample Requests:
            
    GET /api/short-urls/query/unused
    GET /api/short-urls/query/unused?olderThanDays=30&pageNumber=1&pageSize=25
    GET /api/short-urls/query/unused?pageNumber=2&pageSize=50

This endpoint returns short URLs that have never been accessed (click count is 0).
The olderThanDays parameter helps identify URLs that have been unused for a specific period,
which is useful for cleanup operations and identifying potentially obsolete URLs.
If olderThanDays is not specified, all unused URLs are returned regardless of their creation date.

parameters.name: olderThanDays
parameters.description: Optional. Filter to include only URLs that are older than the specified number of days. If not provided, returns all unused URLs regardless of age.

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: The page number to retrieve (starting from 1). Default is 1.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of items per page. Default is 50, maximum is 100.

403.description: User does not have permission to view unused URLs.

200.description: Returns the paginated list of unused short URLs.

400.description: The request parameters are invalid (e.g., negative olderThanDays value, invalid pagination parameters).

get.summary: Resolves a short code to its original URL or initiates the password-protected redirect flow.

parameters.name: shortCode
parameters.description: The unique code associated with the shortened URL.

301.description: Permanent redirect to the original URL.

302.description: Redirect to the password entry page for protected URLs.

404.description: No URL found for the specified short code.

get.summary: Renders the password entry page for a protected short URL.

parameters.name: token
parameters.description:
A short-lived redirect token (JWT) issued by M:Shortly.API.Controllers.ShortUrlRedirectController.RedirectToUrl(System.String,System.Threading.CancellationToken).

This token grants temporary access to the password entry form.

parameters.name: error
parameters.description: Optional error message displayed to the user.

200.description: Password form displayed successfully.

403.description: Token is invalid, expired, or missing.

post.summary: Verifies the submitted password for a protected short URL and redirects on success.

token.description: The short-lived redirect token identifying the short code in question.

200.description: Password incorrect  form re-rendered with error.

301.description: Password correct  redirected to the original URL.

400.description: Bad Request

403.description: Invalid or expired redirect token.

delete.summary: Performs a soft delete on a user, marking them as deleted without permanently removing the record.
delete.description:
This operation performs a soft delete, meaning the user record is marked as deleted
but remains in the database for audit purposes. The current user's ID is automatically
recorded as the one who performed the deletion.

parameters.description: The unique identifier of the user to delete.
